page.title: 11Lilley, Luton
page.content: Lilley is a small rural village on the outskirts of Luton. On the A505 road to Hitchin. It is a linear form on the dip slope of the Chiltern Hills with a southerly aspect. The village is a 'commuter suburb' providing a rural environment for people working in Luton, London and Hitchin. There is one shop, a barn of a local farm and two public houses and a pond. The church is the largest building in the village. Rebuilt in the 1870's it stands on the site of a twelfth century building. The village is surrounded on all sides by arable land. It retains a strong farming character despite the closeness of Luton because of the three farms that front the main street that is effectively the only street of the village.
